number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												Hydrophobia Prophecy isn't very good. But before I get into why, it's not completely awful. Considering it's a 2010 game, the graphics aren't bad, though not amazing. But it's the water physics that is this game's shining crown and glory. The water flows, pours and ripples naturally, not too clear and not too murky. When you open doors or break glass with varying water levels, the water flows from one area to another in waves and levels out. Dark Energy Digital have produced a very good water physics simulator in their HydroEngine. It's just a pity they didn't put as much effort into the game itself.Why did I think this game was bad? Hydrophobia Prophecy aims to be a cover-based, stealth shooter, similar vein to Deus Ex but without the RPG elements. But the stealth elements are absolutely horrible as cover is the only real element that provides stealth. Because the stealth is so bad, the game becomes a generic, watered-down, cover-based shooter. You have 1 weapon with 5 different ammo (i.e. stun, single shot, auto-fire, remote detonation grenade and remote detonation shock grenade). Majority of encounters involved me shooting a guy enough times in the face before he killed me, waiting for my health to regenerate before moving onto the next guy.Hydrophobia Prophecy is only worth having a go if you're interested in water physics in games. Otherwise the game is not very well done due to many flaws and bugs, only being about 3 hours long, poor design and poor mechanics. Dark Energy Digital went under after low sales of this game, which is unfortunately what happens when you produce a sub-par game. More unfortunately is their response to some negative reviews which can be read about in this article. Looking at the title image below, don't get fooled into thinking this is an action game where you use your magical water power to defeat the bad guys. The below image represents about 8.5% of the game, 6% of that being an awful, awkward, out of the blue boss fight.For full review, visit:http://icarusreviews.net/2014/10/03/hydrophobia-prophecy/

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 20, 2014
												First Impression Review of Hydrophobia: ProphecyThe first things I noticed when I  turned on this game were that the graphics were beautiful, the voice acting was impressive and my computer would never be able to run it properly in a million years.  After a few restarts and a lot of tweaking of settings I managed to get Hydrophobia to run by sacrificing the graphics and pretty much everything else.When the game starts, it throws you immediately into the story. Hydrophobia: Prophecy is set on a city sized boat called Queen Of The World, sometime during the mid 21st century. Queen Of The World is  having some sort of anniversary celebration (whether anniversary of it’s founding or anniversary of completing a trip around the world I’m not sure) and out of the blue, the main communications server goes offline. Kate Wilson, a systems engineer, goes to investigate. With communications down a terrorist organization called the Malthusians hack the main security computer and a series of explosions rip holes into the hull.Overall, the game seems quite well made with only a few minor bugs (some of the items float randomly when picked up rather than staying in your hand) and a dynamic liquid system that I haven’t seen anywhere else. However, one thing I can criticize is that the level design is quite confusing, often leading me to walk off in the wrong direction with little reward for doing so.As a summary, Hydrophobia: Prophecy is a promising title and from what I’ve seen in my 77 minutes in-game it is well worth its $5.00 price tag, despite its few issues.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												This game I would call more of a Show piece. yes the game is serviceable but its main focus is showing off the engine. The weapon your given has unlimited ammo as long as you charge it as the first ammo type you get and personaly I dont have a need for the other 4 types of ammo  with targets down in 1 or 2 shots. The story is borderline a Tom Clancy game, Everything is peaceful, terrorist f*** things up and you need to fix it. Though all this the main character actually just feels like her role before all the issues hit. She isnt a sharp shooter and on normal she is very weak, she feels and plays like a regular person(besides her ability to hold her breath). Control wise this game is almost poor. Walking and swiming feel clunky and if the water isnt deep enough to swim over but still too deep to walk around you get some intresting bugs. This game has a stealth system but if the water gets too deep you make a moan and alert everyone near by. so far the game preformed decent until Act 3. Act 3 i had my mouse not respond 3 times in a row from an awkward bug i got while swiming and aiming. Overall the game looks nice, i just wish the combat and movement were a little less clunky so I could enjoy it. Now here is my biggest issue, at the time of writing this I am 2.2hrs in and the game is ALMOST OVER. luckly I got this on sale and didnt pay the $5 (I think this is still $15 or $20 on Xbox). So beware this game is EXTREAMLY SHORT and your in for about a 3hr story and a challage room(which I havent tried yet). But if your a Developer looking for an engie to handle water physics this is wonderful engie to use and should give this a shot.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												Tl;dr Some fun and interesting mechanics built over a competent shooter, sadly too short for it's own good but definitely worth the money.When I bought this game it was for $0.54 and I have to be honest I went in expecting to laugh at it... but I'll be damned if it didn't impress me. At first the voice acting (particularly the strange almost-but-not-quite-scottish accent on the main character) and some of the character animation had me convinced I was in for one of those games that's so bad it's good but this is actually a very competently done cover-based shooter with some neat core mechanics and interesting ideas. Firstly there's a kind of batman-esque vision device you can use to track your objective or interface with camera's and doors but it also let's you see digital graffiti and you need it to find some secrets, it was pretty well done and fit into the game well. With a title like hydrophobia you can expect to be doing a lot of swimming but the water gets used as more than another way to get around, you can open doors or shoot out glass to knock over or even drown enemies, you can shoot out bulkheads to make platforming easier or put out fires and there's a bit later in the game (far too late for my liking, you only get to play with it for about a half hour tops and that's if you waste time looking for secrets and dying to the boss) where you even get a small amount of telekinetic control over it. Sadly the game ends just as it hits its stride and with a fairly unsatisfactory conclusion, nothing really gets resolved... like at all, your character falls unconscious when you beat the boss and it cuts to credits.I only have a few minor gripes, for instance I dislike how you use "ctrl" to swim faster and "shift" to descend quickly while on land "ctrl" is crouch and "shift" is sprint. Also sometimes the climbing felt a little clunky and she refused to get in cover once or twice but it's still about as good as any of the recent tomb raider games so that's just nitpicking. Honestly you'll rarely need to use your other ammo types. The starting ammo is unlimited and has a charge shot that knocks most enemies out in one headshot while everything except the explosive jelly/electroshock bullets take far more. The score system isn't really neessary in my opinion, though it is kind of satisfying to get a chain reaction shot off and see your score rocket. Oh, using your environment is a big deal here, you're highly encouraged to shoot just about everything to get an environmental kill but the focus on that means you're literally wading through roomfulls of explosive barrels which can get kind of hairy. The story was okay, the actual plot wasn't anything all that new and it felt very rushed, things get introduced to you very quickly with little in the way of background explanation, but the villains point of view was interesting, a bit bioshock-esque except less subtle, they literally quote the guy they take after in their digital graffiti. I have to give serious respect to the dev though for having a way to give feedback in the main menu even if it is a little crude, more people should do things like that.EDIT: I forgot to mention that the checkpoints can be a little unforgiving at times, it could have done with a few more. There's one climbing section near the end where the object you're climbing shifts and knocks your character off without warning and I was too far over to grab hold again so I died, then it spawned me between four rather tough enemies.All things considered I would still have been happy with the experience if I'd payed full price and that's more than I can say for a lot of games, definitely pick this up if you want something fresh and interesting without a big time commitment. There's some replay value to try and beat your high score and do some challenge maps (which let you play with that woefully underused hydrokinetic ability) if you're into that kind of thing but you probably won't get more than ten hours out of it tops. If there were a sequel I would definitely buy it too, the mechanics need more room to flex and while the story is kind of "meh" I genuinely liked the support character, he made a couple references that actually got a laugh out of me and I want to find out what happened to him.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												This is an interesting game. It's bad but in the good way. It isn't exactly average since it has that little something. But it isn't great either. The water control mechanics are neat and are fun to play with but are in my opinion underused. The story is just okay. It has an interesting world but the game is short. The graphics are average but water is delicious. The combat works but could use some improvement. My main problem with the game is that it's so short. It has some neat things in it but overall it's just an average game in the grand scheme of things. But it has that spark in it. Potential.It is definitely nothing like you've ever played before but it is definitely worth a try for anyone even remotely interested in it.----[Rating weighted based on the genre]----Story: 3/5Gameplay: 3/5Challenge: 3/5Discovery: 2.5/5Replayability: 2/5Aesthetics: 4/5Visuals: 3.5/5Atmosphere: 3/5Music: 3/5

content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
												I recommend this game but only when its on sale not for full price.The graphics are great and the water elements have been done very well, The option to use Mavi for navigation is really good and the character models arent bad either. The bad points of this game have mostly been said already but the length of the game is too short, the water powers are few and unimaginative, most of the gun ammo types are useless, the enemies are idiots (seriously quite a lot of the time a few of them would just stare at the ceiling) and quite frankly the story escalated immensely quickly and didnt make a lot of sense, the location was also confusing was I on a boat, a city, a city that was a boat i couldnt say. Even with all that i definitely think it is worth the 39p that it is going for at the moment I mean there are some games out there not even worth that much *cough* Ride to Hell *cough*

content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												I bought this on sale, and it was worth what I payed. After completing the first level, with naive optimism that it might get better, the game stopped working. I couldn't load my save file, and when I reached the end of the level, the game crashed. What I did play was... lackluster, for lack of a better term. I took my time, watched the cutscenes, and all I could think is "why am I supposed to care?" Normally, I would give a game an hour or two to give me a reason, but the 15 or so minutes of gameplay didn't do it, and the cutscenes just gave setup for a promising story. But then the fire nation attacked then the terrorists bombed everything. The game was more interesting as a setting (city on a ship, dystopia, etc.) than it was as a game.3/10, made me buy it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												If you took Dead Space, minus anything scary, and Mass Effect, minus any semblance of plot, and combined them together you would still have a better game than Hydrophobia: ProphecyThe controls are clunky, the puzzles add up to either "swim up/down" or "jump to ledges and hope the game decides you grabbed them"Any "plot" in this game could be summed up by saying "Die Hard on a Boat in the Future"The voice acting is the sort of dull surprise and awkward shouting that plagued every bargain bin adventure game in the last two decades.I'm trying to find a worse use for five dollars, but even burning them would at least provide some warmth.

content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												8\10Graphics: 3\5Sound: 2\5Map Design: 4\5Gameplay: 4\5Story: 3\5Just wow. The day i had the fear of sharks in gaming i promised to never touch water again. Until i meet Hydrophobia: Prophecy. A game with fine graphics and a amazingly well designed physical enviroment where water really has a great purpose. 4.99 is not alot to price this and personally it should cost more. The game is short but yet still fun. Even if i did get angry in most sections... Hydrophobia: Prophecy is soo good i even brought my brother a copy in happyness towards this game. There are no sequels i am aware of sadly but I'm sure this game will make its way back.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2015
												Eh, my experience with this game was bad, but probably because i went in with a bad mindstate. The beginning of the game was kinda rushed i guess, you wake up, grab tablet, go to work, then sh*t goes down, in 2 minutes, you're already in a sinking ship. I just felt that it was rushing you.Now, oh GOSH the lag on this game. I have it lowest settings on an almost brand new laptop and it STILL lags.From what looks like a selling point on the screenshots, you can control water, YES, but um... for the last 10 minutes of the game.... so nvm about that.And as everyone is saying, final boss makes no sence to the story, but my thoughts on the final boss is F*CK THE FINAL BOSS, either my game glitched, or im misunderstanding something, but the enemies that the boss spawns are for some reason invincable for me, and i don't want to have to deal with it.So overall, i'd say the game isn't bad, but it's not good either. It can be fun at times, but sometimes what you're supposed to do isn't exactly clear. It's fun to relieve the Titanic in a futuristic way, but this time with a bad final boss.7.8/10 Too much water

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2014
												Lets get right down to it, is Hydrophobia: Prophecy bad?Mechanically its ok, it works, the level design is solid, the water physics are frankly FANTASTIC, and overall the game functions pretty well. This game isn't a buggy mess or unfinished or a slog as I would have expected from the score.Storywise however it could use some work, the dialogue could use some improvement especially in the introduction which has some very shakey voice acting. Combat is somewhat repeditive and an unituitive puzzle required me to shoot some dangling electrical cords right next to some explosive barrels instead of the barrels themselves.Overall though after asking myself "Would this be worth five bucks?" If you can ignore the introduction and don't really mind the plot then I would say this game is definately worth five bucks. Especially the first time you open a door from a flooded room and realize "holy crap this water isn't pre-animated."

content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												I find the environment and  game mechanics from this game worth the 5 dollar price tag. The game is short, but even there, is fun and rewarding. (8 hours for me an still going, some people report 3.5/4 hours,don't get the game rushing thing) If you play with a gamepad everything works as it should, the covering system even working better than some triple A titles. The water environment works ok in 2 aspects -> The interaction with the water (besides diving / swimming you can even "use" it later on the game)-> The "oppression" you feel most of the time, due to the fact that it's a sinking ship Overall, the game justifies the price and it's fun to play. I cannot talk about keyboard / mouse control on this title, since I tend to play all of these game types on game pad from my coach. I guess graphics are ok, but it's not a primary thing on my list. This game gets on bundles often, I say is a plus for the bundle.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2011
												Let's cut too the chase. Hydrophobia is a broken, janky game. Gameplay is finicky, the A.I. is poor, the story is confusing, the acting is inconsistent at best, the deaths are always cheap and its terribly short.And in the end, I don't think I care about any of that.Hydrophobia may be a foundementally flawed game, but it succeeds in delievering an experience you have never encountered in a game. It reminds me a lot of games like Free Radical's 'Second Sight' of EA's 'Mirror's Edge'; both are nowhere near perfect games. But because they offered up a gameplay experience or asethetic distinct from what we as gamers are typically given, makes them capivating and brilliant in their own right. So yes this games is a mess, but for the moments when everything comes together you can't help but find yourself completely taken into the world.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 17, 2011
												I own both the Xbox 360 and PC versions and running them side-by-side, the PC wins hands down. We wouldn't have Hydrophobia if it wasn't for the Xbox Live to give this indie crew a chance, but man... the story depth has really been cleaned up on the PC version and while I really enjoyed what was already there with the X360 version, the addition of the cutscenes is a blessing: it adds so much more to the tension. Graphics have been improved, sound has been improved (though I disagree with replacing the voice actor for Scoot: the original was much better!), controls are open for both gamepad and mouse/keyboard (both with their pros & cons) and the gameplay has benefit a lot from the extra time/funding the development team had for this version. Yes, it's still a work in progress (dev team has added an in-game feedback option for PC gamers), but dammit: you _must_ buy this game. Adventure/action lovers rejoice: Kate knocks the old Lara Croft right out of the park.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2013
												First off...it's a short game.  But it's an interesting game as well that has a bit of challenge too it.  The game has a variety of aspects to it: a bit of puzzle solving, a bit of shooting, a bit of creepy giggling dead girl (stay underwater for a while...you'll start to hear it), and of course...water physics (and of course no game with a female protagonist can avoid the all mighty overamped boob physics).  The water actually reacts in what seems like a realistic way including waves rolling through and walls of water flowing down hallways when doors are opened.  It's a great game if you're waiting for a new game to come out and need something to hold you over for several days.  Definitely worth a look.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												Honestly? As fun as this game gets to be at the end (at least, somewhat), the main ability that causes fun in the game, namely being able to manipulate the water and stuff in it, comes really close to the end, is quite limited, and it doesn't give you a whole lot of time to adjust to it. That's what really hurts it in my eyes. If they gave you more time with that power, more variations on it than just a pillar of water (possibly even puzzles with a 'parting the seas' kind of thing), and a bit more puzzling than shooting, it'd be amazing. As it stands, slightly meh. The ammo, while giving variety, is mostly useless. You only have to use one of the four extra ammo types at the very end, and I found myself using the default (and infinite, and chargeable) ammo type.Something I would have loved to see is a large area or two where you could get to play with the water manipulation, have it be more central to a puzzle than 'Move box, throw bomb, etc', and just more variation on the power.It's rather short, kinda worth it at bottom sale price, but it's not as stellar as it could have been. It's just a side effect of dated tech, really.In general:Environment: Captures the feel of a dying ship quite well.Story: Leaves A LOT unanswered and feels kinda flat at the end.Gunplay: Works well enough from what I played, variation mostly underused.Movement: Works very well, though a bit tedious to move through water that's just about at swimming depth at times. Swimming is nice and fluid.Ability: Fun, but not enough time to get used to it, nor enough done with it.Graphics: Good enough, but I'm not the type to insta-praise graphics that try to be ultra-realistic for the time.Water Physics: Best. Just.. You can tell that's were a lot of effort went when developing the game.Overall? Par for the time, minus a good bit for the lack of puzzle variety and power utilization, plus a bit for the water physics.5(ish)/10. If you're looking for a decent game for about a dollar (during the current sale), feel free to get it. Just don't get your hopes up too high.Review system: Meh/Bleh. Needs a more.. Precise thing than just Yes/No for reccomending it. But then again, I'm just asking too much from Steam there.

content:
Posted: May 11, 2014
												Hydrophobia is a game that's got great gameplay and a decent amount of puzzle solving.  Sadly, though, it runs out of both pretty quickly.  A few more mechanics would have made it amazing, but it works with what it has.  This leads onto the game's major flaw: Hydrophobia is very short.  One can understand why this is, though, the game's levels explore its limited mechanics thoroughly, and more would have become repeditive.The controls are a little bit awkward, it's clearly a console port and doesn't handle keyboard and mouse so well and has some weird accelleration.  It also ran my laptop very hot with the settings turned up to mid-high, but there wasn't much stuttering.  The game could probably be optimised somewhat.  If the developers had have spent more time polishing the game, it would have been quite excellent.Overall, it's an entertaining little game.  Don't expect it to be taken away by it, but it's worth the few dollars you'll pay for it.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												The game looks beautiful and the water physics are very well done. The platforming and puzzles are not too confusing and feel rewarding. However the story was rather short, only 4 hours or so and it leaves a lot left for the player to think about as the ending is confusing and felt rather rushed. The combat works pretty well, with cover mechanics and different ammo types, along with the power to control water which is great fun. The combat can feel rather awkward and clunky sometimes as the enemy AI is usually stupid. The guns didnt really sounds like guns either, more like someone making the sound effects with their mouth, but overall the combat was pretty fun.In conclusion I think Hydrophobia is a good game for what it's worth (5 bucks, currently 99 cents as I write this review), and looks very very nice. However A sequel or an expansion would be great to fill up those plot holes. I do reccomend this game if you want some thing short, fun, cheap and well designed.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												I hate this game.  The gameplay is a boring combination of platforming and shoddy 3rd person shooting in a lame sci-fi ship setting.  I found the main character's voice acting a bit annoying sounding.  Your main weapon is a weird charging beam that one shot's all enemies when you charge it so I don't really know why there's actual ammo when you kill everything in one hit.  The game's main draw is water physics, which is underwhelming.  The water is still scripted to only fill rooms at certain parts and while not annoying, doesn't really add anything to the experience.  The graphics are subpar and the game chugs pathetically at times for no reason.  Only worth $1 or less.  The game is also only 3-4 hours long.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
http://hereberants.wordpress.com/2014/11/10/hydrophobia-prophecy-2010/When loading up the game I seemed to have selected the ‘Looks like♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ option and everything is pixelated it’s literally maxed out on all the graphic settings and it still looks like a pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ the game for some reason doesn’t like to default to my screen size so I got 420p rather than 1080p but even after reloading and sorting this still looked a bit♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ The menu screen as well is extremely small and I can’t read any of the options I’m going to assume the top one is start and the next one down is continue.The intro was alright I seemed to have skipped straight to the end because my character was floating in water and I thought ‘Wow this looks good, how do I move, oh wait it’s a cut scene…’ Then a cardinal sin was committed, a jump scare, jump scares are cheap, cheaper than the developers mum on a Friday night, it wasn’t even scary there was a scream and a face really close up.I wake up from a dream having been scared by myself in the dream and then the telly is all like ‘EVERYTHING IS AWESOME, LOOK YOU’VE BEEN HERE TEN YEARS WOOO GO WHEREVER WE ARE’ and then my TV cuts out. And so my adventure begins. Seriously your TV breaks and Kate (the protagonist) effectively assumes terrorists.I didn’t know what was happening nor the urgency of the matter and so I endeavoured to examine my living quarters. My character has an obsession with pillows and chairs because those were the only things I could find, going upstairs that is all there is to play with, pillows. Considering she lives on her own with very few misc. possessions which I can get points for picking up. I’m not sure what I’m supposed to do with the things I pick up and look at, let alone the points I gain, it’s all very confusing. For 40p I didn’t expect much but the games loading screen showed me magical powers and by Jove I’ll get those powers if it kills me (get it, because that was a spoiler!). The physics engine known as the HydroEngine assuming was specially made to measure for this game, it doesn’t do character models very well but it does damn fine pillows and water, and there is lots of water, don’t worry if there isn’t much water yet, that is main plot we didn’t forget about that. Obviously trying to get their money’s worth out of it.While running around my apartment I noticed the controls handle like a lubed up whale made of bricks being directed through a needle by Michael.J.Fox (I’ve been waiting to use that for a while now). Because turning round takes a good second and then Kate stops and turns making it difficult to see where one is going, since it is third person and the camera is controlled by the mouse and movement by keyboard. There is an interface system called MAVI that can detect and use things at a distance as well as being used as part of the hacking mini game, which I quite like it is a relatively easy thing to do and shouldn’t be. I don’t want to spend 20 minutes playing a minigame to unlock something in a chest like Fallout 3 I want to do it to progress the plot like in Bioshock Infinite, but I actually have to do something unlike Bioshock Infinite.Okay so part of the intro is to go and look out at the city from my balcony, the render distance was appalling and I didn’t see very much there were about 5 buildings in my frame of view and this was supposed to strike awe into me, they failed miserably.You seem to have an assistant that talks to you over your earpiece and he sounds very stereotypically American and his voice acting is terrible, he sounds like he should be a voice over for a failing Michael Bay movie. My character seems to mixed nationality being part; Brit, Aussie, South African and USA. This makes it sound like she’s winey and in need all the time though her voice acting isn’t too bad considering.Note: I had so much beef I wrote 5 pages of notes on why I don’t like this game compared to half a page on Bioshock Infinite, perspective people.Kate wondering why her TV has shut off she wonders on down to security to check everything is okay and the lift she is in blows up. Bearing in mind she is a low level engineer at this point, then the areas she is in starts to flood and she must navigate her way to security to find out what is going on, like I have said I really like the water physics in this game, I think more time needs to be spent on the gameplay rather than the engine so any subsequent game that bothers to put the time in, to use this engine might be something worthwhile.When I first started coming in contact with areas that were parts of the map where destroyed the first scream that I heard without a shadow of a doubt was a full blown Wilhelm scream. I felt like giving up, this was one of the many things that made me want to just throw down my mouse and leave, despite the game being like a 5/10 at this point and showed no sign of deterioration. This is where♥♥♥♥♥♥went downhill.After getting to security and finding the footage of terrorists there was a Lara Croft style balancing challenge where you must walk across a beam in order to unlock the door or something. The balancing wasn’t hard it’s the fact that I could jump across the beam in half the time by spamming space for a bit, the fact I can do this annoys me to my very core.My next beef came in the form of an lift shaft I couldn’t get up because when I climbed any further Kate rag dolled and died because the lift fell down, and I had to hear the same ‘my arms are shaking!’ line about 12 times before I said ♥♥♥♥ it and Googled the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of it, and I discovered a steam forum dedicated to taking the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of this game.I figured it out you have to shimmy along a bar, you then climb into a room behind you that you can’t see because camera angle is awkward, logic. The next challenge I faced was breaking the head of security out of burning room that was difficult because my waypoint was set to somewhere I couldn’t reach.I entered a hallway where the waypoint had told me, that had jets of fire coming out of the ceiling on both the left and the right, as well as the floor caved it. My approach was to shimmy around a space to the right where there was slightly more floor. The screen washed out and I died and the guy on the headset went ‘Kate are you alright?’ she’s fine mate just a bit dead. My second try was to jump across the gap when the left fire jet stopped for a second then continued. I jumped across the jump arch was long enough to clear the section but I rag dolled and died again for no apparent reason. The next ten minutes was then spent trying to clear this gap in the two ways just specified. I then stopped playing admitting defeat. This made me feel bad and I re-entered the game in the hopes of finding a solution, after climbing to a different part of the map, I discovered that the actual pause screen map was 100% three dimensional, this made me feel better. It turns out that rather than any solution being obvious to see there was a bar you are supposed to shimmy along on the left… I entered the corridor from the left this means my camera is facing right, so I won’t see that bar unless I run around in circle and see the bright red bar on the pale green/blue wall (bearing in mind I am RED GREEN colour-blind). I then proceeded to shimmy across, I made sure that the when the jet had finished I didn’t go onto the glowing section of the bar I was holding on to and waited for it to cool down. It doesn’t cool so I waited thinking Kate would burn her hands on the glowing white metal bar, but turns out she is resistant to heat completely unless they are flames, then you’re in trouble.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
http://hereberants.wordpress.com/2014/11/10/hydrophobia-prophecy-2010/When loading up the game I seemed to have selected the ‘Looks like♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ option and everything is pixelated it’s literally maxed out on all the graphic settings and it still looks like a pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ the game for some reason doesn’t like to default to my screen size so I got 420p rather than 1080p but even after reloading and sorting this still looked a bit♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ The menu screen as well is extremely small and I can’t read any of the options I’m going to assume the top one is start and the next one down is continue.The intro was alright I seemed to have skipped straight to the end because my character was floating in water and I thought ‘Wow this looks good, how do I move, oh wait it’s a cut scene…’ Then a cardinal sin was committed, a jump scare, jump scares are cheap, cheaper than the developers mum on a Friday night, it wasn’t even scary there was a scream and a face really close up.I wake up from a dream having been scared by myself in the dream and then the telly is all like ‘EVERYTHING IS AWESOME, LOOK YOU’VE BEEN HERE TEN YEARS WOOO GO WHEREVER WE ARE’ and then my TV cuts out. And so my adventure begins. Seriously your TV breaks and Kate (the protagonist) effectively assumes terrorists.I didn’t know what was happening nor the urgency of the matter and so I endeavoured to examine my living quarters. My character has an obsession with pillows and chairs because those were the only things I could find, going upstairs that is all there is to play with, pillows. Considering she lives on her own with very few misc. possessions which I can get points for picking up. I’m not sure what I’m supposed to do with the things I pick up and look at, let alone the points I gain, it’s all very confusing. For 40p I didn’t expect much but the games loading screen showed me magical powers and by Jove I’ll get those powers if it kills me (get it, because that was a spoiler!). The physics engine known as the HydroEngine assuming was specially made to measure for this game, it doesn’t do character models very well but it does damn fine pillows and water, and there is lots of water, don’t worry if there isn’t much water yet, that is main plot we didn’t forget about that. Obviously trying to get their money’s worth out of it.While running around my apartment I noticed the controls handle like a lubed up whale made of bricks being directed through a needle by Michael.J.Fox (I’ve been waiting to use that for a while now). Because turning round takes a good second and then Kate stops and turns making it difficult to see where one is going, since it is third person and the camera is controlled by the mouse and movement by keyboard. There is an interface system called MAVI that can detect and use things at a distance as well as being used as part of the hacking mini game, which I quite like it is a relatively easy thing to do and shouldn’t be. I don’t want to spend 20 minutes playing a minigame to unlock something in a chest like Fallout 3 I want to do it to progress the plot like in Bioshock Infinite, but I actually have to do something unlike Bioshock Infinite.Okay so part of the intro is to go and look out at the city from my balcony, the render distance was appalling and I didn’t see very much there were about 5 buildings in my frame of view and this was supposed to strike awe into me, they failed miserably.You seem to have an assistant that talks to you over your earpiece and he sounds very stereotypically American and his voice acting is terrible, he sounds like he should be a voice over for a failing Michael Bay movie. My character seems to mixed nationality being part; Brit, Aussie, South African and USA. This makes it sound like she’s winey and in need all the time though her voice acting isn’t too bad considering.Note: I had so much beef I wrote 5 pages of notes on why I don’t like this game compared to half a page on Bioshock Infinite, perspective people.Kate wondering why her TV has shut off she wonders on down to security to check everything is okay and the lift she is in blows up. Bearing in mind she is a low level engineer at this point, then the areas she is in starts to flood and she must navigate her way to security to find out what is going on, like I have said I really like the water physics in this game, I think more time needs to be spent on the gameplay rather than the engine so any subsequent game that bothers to put the time in, to use this engine might be something worthwhile.When I first started coming in contact with areas that were parts of the map where destroyed the first scream that I heard without a shadow of a doubt was a full blown Wilhelm scream. I felt like giving up, this was one of the many things that made me want to just throw down my mouse and leave, despite the game being like a 5/10 at this point and showed no sign of deterioration. This is where♥♥♥♥♥♥went downhill.After getting to security and finding the footage of terrorists there was a Lara Croft style balancing challenge where you must walk across a beam in order to unlock the door or something. The balancing wasn’t hard it’s the fact that I could jump across the beam in half the time by spamming space for a bit, the fact I can do this annoys me to my very core.My next beef came in the form of an lift shaft I couldn’t get up because when I climbed any further Kate rag dolled and died because the lift fell down, and I had to hear the same ‘my arms are shaking!’ line about 12 times before I said ♥♥♥♥ it and Googled the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of it, and I discovered a steam forum dedicated to taking the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of this game.I figured it out you have to shimmy along a bar, you then climb into a room behind you that you can’t see because camera angle is awkward, logic. The next challenge I faced was breaking the head of security out of burning room that was difficult because my waypoint was set to somewhere I couldn’t reach.I entered a hallway where the waypoint had told me, that had jets of fire coming out of the ceiling on both the left and the right, as well as the floor caved it. My approach was to shimmy around a space to the right where there was slightly more floor. The screen washed out and I died and the guy on the headset went ‘Kate are you alright?’ she’s fine mate just a bit dead. My second try was to jump across the gap when the left fire jet stopped for a second then continued. I jumped across the jump arch was long enough to clear the section but I rag dolled and died again for no apparent reason. The next ten minutes was then spent trying to clear this gap in the two ways just specified. I then stopped playing admitting defeat. This made me feel bad and I re-entered the game in the hopes of finding a solution, after climbing to a different part of the map, I discovered that the actual pause screen map was 100% three dimensional, this made me feel better. It turns out that rather than any solution being obvious to see there was a bar you are supposed to shimmy along on the left… I entered the corridor from the left this means my camera is facing right, so I won’t see that bar unless I run around in circle and see the bright red bar on the pale green/blue wall (bearing in mind I am RED GREEN colour-blind). I then proceeded to shimmy across, I made sure that the when the jet had finished I didn’t go onto the glowing section of the bar I was holding on to and waited for it to cool down. It doesn’t cool so I waited thinking Kate would burn her hands on the glowing white metal bar, but turns out she is resistant to heat completely unless they are flames, then you’re in trouble.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 19, 2014
												Well, I read alot of reviews saying that the game pretty much sucks.  It does not suck.  Despite the bad reviews I couldn't pass it up on sale for $0.49.  This game has some neat features in it.  The main issue is that there's really no need to use the neat features.  The game is very linear so there's never an opportunity to experiment using different abilities to clear an area.  What I liked: The use of fire, water, electricity, gravity was done pretty well.  The manipulation of world objects wasn't really as limited as most games.  If you see a box it can be moved, thrown, blown up, etc.  You can use bad guys and world objects equally to create havok.The animations were pretty good.  The character struggled through hip deep water, sloshed through knee deep water, and gasped for air appropriately.  The character acts like it's running out of air when the breath meter gets to a certain point (swimming more erratically and paniced) Cover animations were decent and there were even fairly good proximity animations which alot of games tend to ignore. (Stand close to fire and the character shields her face.)The story wasn't blockbuster but was fast paced. There were a lot of cutscenes too, which I'm a fan of.  I want to see things unfold, not just hit a button and proceed.  Makes it more cinematic.What I didn't like: The boss fight was challenging but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.  Also slightly confusing.The level design was pretty weak.  There isn't really any sense to the layout of this place.  Two achievements are for 1. getting all the objects and 2. getting all the medals.  There's no indication of how many you missed.  As far as I know there's no list of medals that can be obtained either. You just play and try to get them?  Not cool.You couldn't use abilities creatively enough.  You get a chance to open doors with hazards behind them as a learning part of the story, but then really never get to do it again.  Using the handheld tool you can see if there's water or fire or nothing behind a door but if it's off the path it's either locked or malfunctioning which means it might as well just be another wall.  You can shoot out glass doors, which is great fun, but pointless since there's nothing to do but then just move on content with the knowledge that you just shot a door.The bad guys weren't intelligently placed.  They just kind of showed up in places that made no sense here and there to make you shoot things.  The bad guy placement was so bad that the majority of boss fight baddies can be left to the boss to take out.All in all it's another linear shooter.  If it's linear, and a shooter, 99% of the time it'll also be generic.  It'd be worth it at $9.99.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Graphics: Feels unfinished. too often do i stare at things that only slightly feel out of place. It is however, not bad. Especially when it comes to the water! The water itself would get a solid 10/10, rest of the graphics 6/10, mainly due to the poor cutscene dialogue's (I CANNOT stand impropper lipsyncing).(8/10 Total)Audio:Audio often weirded me out. I understand that the childs voice you hear underwater is PROBABLY from your trauma as you near suffocation underwater.... but hearing them the moment you jump into the water?The voice used for Kate does not feel authentic either.(4/10 total)Story:A horribly generic--- yet enjoyable storyline. The thing is however, that if you'd cut the whole story out, you would not be missing anything essential. The game feels seperated from the story (this may differ if you're a true collecter of collectables and learn more about the backstory). This does not matter however, seeing as the gameplay itself is of great quality.(7/10 total)Overal:The game plays very well, it also has a GREAT feel to it. It does feel a bit unfinished however and i'm sure that with just a bit of polishing it would be perfect feel-wise.Is it worth playing? Yes.Is it worth buying? Maybe. If it's on sale like it is now (-80%, 0,99 cents from 4,99) then yes, definately. The full price of 4,99 however, is barely worth it, seeing as the game is rather short (Completed in under 3 hours)I do however, hope for a sequal to come out in which the audio/graphics are fully polished and the game lasts -+20 hours, which in my opinion, should be easily doable since some of the technique's you unlock at the end (no spoilers) will only be used for puzzling once or never.If they manage to do all that, the game would be worth at least 29,99.Final Score 7/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17, 2012
												An interesting game with really amazing water physics, but it's unfortunately lacking in some other aspects. But for the low price it went down to, it's a bargain. As I'm writing this, it's just 1,24€ here (on -75% daily deal). The reason to get it is the fantastic water physics implemented that I haven't seen done so well in any other game. You'll enjoy the really natural look of the water filling the sinking ship you're in. It rises, it has currents, waves, very naturally flows out of flooded rooms as you open the door, releasing the water... The surface ripples according to all water movement and reflects the light beautifully. However... this game is very short. And the action aspects (shooting, that is) aren't done so well. The weapons are kinda lame and it generally feels pretty static compared to typical action games. I consider this game a demonstration of the impressive water engine and it's a shame they didn't put as much work on other things. But try it out!

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2011
												Bought this while it was on sale for $3.00, let me tell you, THAT WAS A COMPLETE STEAL!  The water physics are amazingly good (better than you will see in any other game for 2011), and even though the plot is small and more or less easy to understand what happened during the events (not so much of the character back story), it's still a good game.  In a small nut shell:Pros:Good (but small) plot.Water physics are amazing.Has an okay cover and fire system.Cons:The camera is a little buggy, but you not to the point that it's unplayable.Depth of Field is going to take a minute or 2 too get used to but again, not a major issue.Expect to die a few times because you are up against AI with Shotguns and ARs while you only have a pistol (with different ammo types but you will mostly be using stun like ammo.) and your health is a joke.I know there are more cons then Pros, but its really a good game.

												Great game, but crappy ending.  It's a lot like Tomb Raider but with enough different to not be a clone. You're still trapped in a sinking city/ship, you just got cool powers and BOOM, the end.  Lame.  I do recommend it for the overall play, but don't expect any form of an ending that will make you happy.

content:

												Not entirely sure why there are so many mixed reviews for this game. Sure Hydrophobia isn't the greatest game out there. The visuals aren't incredible, by any means. The audio is "meh" at best. I saw someone mention that the water physics were good. Posted: September 4, 2012
												For less than $5, it's probably worth checking out. But don't expect it to be a solid shooter, because it's anything but. Pretty much every mechanic is this game feels clunky in one way or another, and even the water physics feel rather strange despite it being the main feature. Underwater combat can get pretty hectic as enemies can come from any direction, barrels and crap floating around more often than not, get in the way of combat. And oh, did I mention that the enemy uses bullet while you use a sonic gun which projectiles are larger and move slower? Also have a slower firing rate? You do get some sort of superpower towards the end, but it's not so super, and well... Rather disappointing.That said, the water mechanics are interesting to look at and is rather unique. Grab it during a sale if you can though.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2011
												This is a fun game.   It isn't a great game.    But if you go in knowing what to expect and without having exaggerated expectations,   it is fun.    It has cheesy writing at times,   it has bad enemy AI,   and it has a mediocre story.But,   it does have rather fun gameplay,   a decent amount of Tomb Raider-esque exploration,   plenty of time spent splashing around in that water that we gamers oh so love,  and some of the best water physics seen in any game to date.    It is also worth at least two play throughs.However,   due to my "$1 per hour having fun" rule for games,   I can't recommend this game at full price,   even at the low price tag of $12USD.    If you're quick,  it can be completed twice in as quickly as 6 hours.    But next time this game goes on sale,   it is definitely worth picking up.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												Hydrophobia: Prophecy. What I think of it.Warning! Long review is long. You have been warned.-Default Gameplay Mechanics: 7/10 The default buttons are a bit annoying, but they can be remapped. Way points are misleading and don't help when you're stuck.There are things you have to look at very closely to be able to progress. The cover system sometimes doesn't wanna work so the character doesn't go for cover. Diving underwater sometimes happened randomly when I didn't want to dive. Health regen system, which is common in many games, makes an appearance in this one. The boss sometimes glitched out (see Boss Difficulty below).-Resolution: 10/10 Many resolutions to pick from. I was able to play it with my laptop connected to my big screen TV via HDMI on full screen.-Maximum Overall Graphics: 10/10 Hands down, the best water graphics I've ever seen. Ending cutscene had the worst graphics in the entire game. Water graphics could easily make up for it.NOTE: The game is all about the water.-Storyline: 6/10 (SPOILERS)A metropolis floating on water is attacked by a terrorist group known as Neo Malthusians. You, the character, are trapped and the area you are in is flooding. With the guidance from your buddy working the security cameras, you find a way to **escape**.It was good for the first 2 acts then suddenly became wtf on the second half of act 3. And it only has 3 acts. The game can be beaten in less than 4 hours if you know what to do. My first playthrough was 4 hours. And that's not beating it 100%.**It has a horrible ending with no resolution of any kind whatsoever. After beating the boss practically nothing happens**-Normal Enemy Difficulty on Easy: 9/10 The enemies were pretty easy. They did get some cheap hits every now and then. It's hard to tell if an enemy is dead or down from a certain distance.-Boss Difficulty: 6/10The last and only boss is ludicrously powerful. A woman (who can be assumed as the terrorist leader) takes control of a machine that has a mini-gun, rocket-type projectiles, and grenade launcher. It sometimes glitched out to the point where I had to restart the battle almost 10 times. When it tossed out bombs, it covered a large portion of the room and they're very hard to see so I didn't know where was considered safe. Getting cornered for one second is almost guaranteed death unless you're lucky to survive.Price: $4.99A bit high price for a short game. I got it when it was on special for $0.49, so I don't really regret it.-Overall: 6.5/10 - Pretty much the MetaScore (for once I agree with it)I liked the game. The majority of the storyline is good and it's not too long to beat. But, it had some painfully obvious problems (everything mentioned above). If the developer/publisher company didn't go bankrupt a couple of years ago, they could have made this game so much better.I'd recommend it, but honestly, you'd be better off buying it on sale for $0.49 than the regular $5 price.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												Probably one of the only games to have such a majority of underwater combat. This was a really fun game, though pretty short. The water simulation was as real as they advertise, and controlling the water later in the game is a definitely good feeling. Sure it takes about half the game to get the water powers, but it reminds me of KotOR; you spend most of your time on Taris as a non-Jedi, but getting those Jedi powers makes it oh so worth it. Also, while dying numerous times, I experienced no glitches.Srsly. On sale for $0.50, you can't go wrong. I only wish they'd make a sequel...or give it Steam Workshop support.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
												Hydrophobia's got novel gameplay and setting, and some seriously impressive water (I spent a lot of time staring at it through the wireframe scanner... the tech is beautiful). Water (and fear of water) are used very well to implement some unique and fun gameplay. Cool hacking and a smooth introduction of new gameplay throughout the game keep it interesting, and the story is promising, as well.Unfortunately this game's clearly rushed near the end, with a large amount of story elements and gameplay mechanics presented to the player all at once. This was originally going to be an episodic release and never saw any sequels. The game still reaches an ending that's fairly satisfying, despite that.The survival mode you unlock by winning at least serves as a fun way to explore the cool new moves they introduce at the end.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 28, 2013
												Despite the reviews that have averaged around 64/100, the game itself must be looked at not for its longevity or story.. It needs to be looked at for it's signature greatness: Realistic water physics! Seriously, for a indie title like this that was created by a handful of developers, it is very very hard to imagine why the hell many AAA title game developers with a extremely high budget can't pump out the same, if not better of a water-physics game! So simply put, if you don't understand what makes this so unique, here it is:The water is very dynamic, and uses Cosine trig functions as a basis for the water's modelling. The water uses many properties from real physics: Room 1 has lower water level, Room 2 has higher water level.. Door opens between the rooms, and Room 2's water flows into Room 1's water until it evens out.Even more exciting: When water flows into a room, waves will come through, pushing your player away, and the water smacks up against a wall them moves in the opposite direction. The water in this game can be manipulated too. If you shoot a glass window with a room full of water, the window will burst and in comes the massive amounts of water. The game is just pure awesome JUST because of the great water physics modelling. Everything else about this game is mediocre, and I can't justify paying full price ($15.00) for this game. I got it on sale and could justify the sale of ($7.00) or lower.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 24, 2012
												Best 1.99 I ever spent.  Decent 3rd-person shooter/platformer that gets by with its unique setting and stunning water effects.  Even years after Hydrophobia's release, its water effects remain unsurpassed.  It flows, splashes, and roars around you while fire and sparks reflect beautifully and convincingly on its surface.  Top notch lighting design and effects also set the mood.   You play an engineer stuck on a giant, sinking, futuristic cruise ship fighting off doomsday terrorists.  The story gives the designers an excuse to stage claustrophic, tense, water logged scenarios reminiscent of the Sega classic Burning Rangers or the film Deep Rising.  It's an uncommon setting in games (perhaps because water was difficult to pull off) and it helps make Hydrophobia stand out from the pack.   The game's low budget origins are apparent-- the characters models are weak and the ending is very abrupt -- but so is its ambition.  Recommended.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												Hydrophobia can be interesting or flat out boring, depending on whether you let flaws get in the way or not. Like most people, I have gotten this game in a bundle on Bundle Stars.Graphics: Decent. Though they appear "shiny" and can make it rather difficult to play, they aren't horrible and can be much worse. Like many other people have pointed out and a big part of the game, the water details are stunning even when set on the lowest texture setting.Gameplay: When it comes to rating a game I try to stay positive, but let's be real now. The controls are god awful. There are plenty of alternatives the developers could have used to make the controls simple and easy to learn. Instead, I have to smash my keyboard to get off from cornering the wall. The story line isn't too bad, but is overly cheesy.Sound Effects and voice acting: Sound effects are neat-o. The voice acting isn't too great but at least they were putting in an attempt. Believe me when I say I have heard MUCH worse.Overall Score: 3/5. It's better than what most people make it as, but isn't THAT great. It's entertaining to play if you have nothing else to do, but not worth the asking price. Wait for it to go on sale or get it in a bundle.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												The game despite being short and quite repetative is worth playing. Why? First let me tell you what is wrong with the game (there is quite a lot!)Cons:-Character handles poorly, especially in 3 deminsional environments.-Story lacking explaination and execution.-Character develpoment: Non Existant.-Missions very repetative.-Platforming not imaginative (in most cases).-Enemies are not very difficult to defeat.-Voice acting is quite bad.-Lip syncing is awful.-Repeated models (for example in one scene two identical men, are lined up and exacuted)...Now you are probably thinking, 'What is the point of playing this game then?'The most standout feature of this game is the level of exploration. At times the game reminds me of the film Posidon Adventure. The game is very good at making the player second guess themselves, and ask questions. Now while this level of exploration is not consistant, for the parts that it is in makes this game highly enjoyable.This game for me personally is a showcase (eventhough to my knowlege it is not), a showcase of the possibilities for games made by larger companies. For example if bioshock or bioshock 2 implmeted the water system that this game uses it could have been probably one of the best games of the decade (it still is very good).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												This is actually a pretty damn enjoyable game (especially at the DAFT-CHEAP price of 40pence(!) when on sale)The Movement / Cover and Weapon usage is passable to Good...Sadly, the story / acting both pretty poor.butMany of the other mechanics here are Decent and FULL of Potential (this was originally planned as a D/L trilogy but only part 1 was ever released)The climbing/Bal;ancing/swimming etc all work nicely together, but the Best Bits of all - and something that happens in No other game- is the water mechanic where the water has real weight and heft. You are on a gigantic sinking ship and, say, you're in a corridor, and a sealed room next to you is full of sea-water, you can shoot out the window and it'll come pounding into the corridor washing everything (and you / Bad Guys) away Very Realistically.You can Electrify the Water/Put out Fires, and so on, Escape as Ocean slowly fills a whole ships levels up with swirling,pushing Ocean, with you desperately trying to get out before it gets to the ceiling and you have no breath left etc. All this Dynamic is unique in gaming and solidly Exciting to enact.(the main character, 'Kate' I think, had a childhood accident in a small Dinghy that killed a Family member, so now she is terrified of Water/Drowning: (Hence the "HydroPhobia" of the title) and she begins to freak out when water gets over her head). The potential for this Tech is just boggling...(if they were ever return to Rapture say, for the final time - With the whole place coming apart,piece by piece, Then this Water Tech would be Incredible to use.Also it was only like a 7 Person team who made this, so not entirely fair to judge by AAA standards - Personally, I think it stands up fairly well, and could have gone on to do Great things ( as you get some kinda 'Water-Controlling' Tech, later in the Game - And use it to overcome the Bads /Solve puzzles Etc which is utterly unique idea ) . Damn Shame.Microsoft bought the Engine in 2010ish but haven't done a thing with it since then - Even a new "Silent Hunter" Sub-Sim, with huge rolling waves at Sea would be Super-Good, I hope they DO do Something with it (or Give it to the MODders to use)WELL WORTH THE PRICE - I personally enjoyed the Game; and was awestruck by the potential of the Tech seen here  7.5/10

content:
Posted: June 29, 2011
												Hydrophobia: Prophecy has gotten a lot of negative press, both for the quality of the game and for the outlandish PR department. Although tempting, it's important to not attribute negative qualities of people to the work they create.That being said, Hydrophobia isn't a very good game. At it's best it oddly reminds me of Beyond Good and Evil. At it's very worst it redefines a new low. The controls are terri-bad (I've never experienced worse controls then the underwater sections.) The optomization is awful, there are constant FPS drops and  an overall low performance. While the graphics are nice, the animations are horrendous. That is, minus the water physics: hands down the best water effects I've ever seen. The story is interesting, if not presented very awkwardly. It's obvious that effort was put into it. The game isn't very long; it took me a little under three hours to complete, not stopping to explore.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												At the beginning I was really enjoying Hydrophobia.  It had a nice post apocalyptic/dystopian feel about it, and lets be honest, the water effects are increadible.  But water doesn't make necessarily make a compelling world - just ask Kevin Costner.  The narative is pretty much 'by the book' stuff, even down to the heard but not seen accomplice who helps you as you begin your escape, right up until he decides to bail and leaves you on your own, but that's not an issue as you're quite self sufficient.  There are a few tricky puzzles, and choosing which ammunition to use during combat can certainly make these things easier or harder as you go along.  There are destrucible parts of the environment (power cables) that you can use to make your life easier - and we all know what happens when electricity hits water...  But all this enjoyment came to an abrupt end with the final battle.  It's cheap, it's annoying, it's frustrating but most of all, it let the story down.  I could have forgiven that battle if it actually tied into the narative, but it feels cheap and tacked on which is a real pity.  I will recommend this game, as I did enjoy it overall, but it did leave a bad taste right at the end.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												The biggest thing I can say about Hydrophobia is that it's damn short. At under three hours, it's one of the shortest commercial releases I know of. It's a third-person shooter with a bit of Uncharted-style climbing, a hacking minigame, and a surprise gameplay twist near the end I won't spoil here, simply because it comes literally out of nowhere. I bought the game about three years ago and never touched it before today, but it proved a satisfying diversion. Hydrophobia is most notable for its water physics- player character Kate Wilson, a systems engineer, is aboard a massive oceangoing vessel in the midst of a terrorist attack, and nearly every area is at least partially flooded. This can be used to the player's advantage, triggering bulkhead breaches to toss enemies about in addition to the more genre-standard exploding barrels and exposed electrical currents. The swimming controls are competent and you have a generous oxygen meter, although the camera can be disorienting. Uniquely, you can grab objects such as crates while underwater and use them as portable cover. You have only one gun, a pistol, but it can be used with five different ammuntion types, including remote-trigger grenades. Hydrophobia succeeds better as an entire game about water levels then most games do in a single segment, and on that merit alone I can recommend it. It seems this title was  the first episode of a series, but the developer has since closed without further episodes being made and this title ends on an extremely abrupt cliffhanger. If that doesn't bother you however, Hydrophobia will make for an enjoyable afternoon.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												I liked this game more than I disliked it, that is why I clicked "yes recommend" this game.  The reality is this game is, for me, very average and disappointing in many ways.My biggest complaint about this game is that it was short.  Like really really short.  It has 3 stages and then it ends, though the stages are fairly long it doesn't really help the matter.  Stemming from that, the story for this game was very ill-handled, by which I mean it wasn't handled.  You get a bit of backstory about how the world basically turned into a new, uninhabitable Pangea, with one giant ocean that a giant city on a boat sails on with all the sane/not criminal members of humanity, and there's a terrorist cell that lives/was exiled to the dried up husk of a continent who think humanity is ruining/ruined the world and needs to die.  There's a lot that they could have done with this to flesh the story out and be something unique or unique-ish, but the story is basically in the background the whole game.  The worst part of this complaint focuses on the main character: an engineer on the ship named Kate Wilson who it is implied by the title has hydrophobia.  This would be a really interesting twist considering how much of the game revolves around water in different gameplay elements (haha, pun) but the only times it really comes up or affects anything is in the beginning when her coworker tells her she can do this, and when she stays underwater for awhile you hear a little girl laughing, which hints at why she has hydrophobia, but it's never explained or explored, and otherwise she might as well not have it at all.The only other complaint I have concerns the water-manipulating aspect of the game, which you don't "unlock" until the 3rd stage, and when you do all you do is raise water into a pillar to splash something or raise something in the water up into the air to touch something for some reason or another.  I can get why they would start out with only this because she's new to this ability, and if the game were longer maybe they would develop that further so she learns how to use water differently, but sadly the game ends before it can get to that point.  At least we got to see the cool-looking glowing effect on her arm for a little bit.I lied earlier, I have one other complaint that I would have tried to go back and integrate into the first complaint paragraph but I don't feel like putting in that kind of effort right now.  The ending itself is really disappointing.  You (spoilers!) kill the terrorist leader and kill the nanites that are giving you water-bending powers from eating your insides out, then basically pass out of relief and the credits role.  No thought is given about the giant ocean-liner with a city that has hundreds of people living on it that's sinking into the ocean, and I guess the rest of the terrorists that were stealing more of those deadly nanites gave up when some psychic call went out about their leader dying.The gameplay was pretty fun, reminded me of Tomb Raider like it reminded everyone else of Tomb Raider.  The graphics looked good, nothing fancy but was nice to look at.  And of course the water physics were exellent.  I may have been slightly drunk while writing this.  I'm sorry.

												I heard this game went through a lot of revision (or some similar version that was on consoles did?) but this game is one of those concept games with a LOT of promise and a serious lack of content.Game ran perfectly fine on highest settings (Radeon 6850 / Phenom II x6 / 8gb ram), no hiccups or glitches.  Controls were spot on except for a lack of ledge-hang button.  I craved the cover controls from Deus Ex Human Revolution (as the mechanics in this game are a little like that).Actual game stuff -- Many ammo types but only a few useful ones (default and EMP for the bossfight).  Combat was fine enough but enemies seemed to spawn out of corners or nooks a few times.  Platforming worked well.  Water powers difficult to control   The water mechanics worked well, but I wished the water pushed me around more, it doesn't quite feel real.The storyline is good, characters good, gameplay good... just NOT enough of it!  I finished this game in only a few hours, just a bit more than 3.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												I didn't enjoy this game as much as I hoped I would. The whole water gimmick was cool at first, but eventually just became annoying.Graphics: The water graphics, for the most part, look decent. The graphics design is pretty cool, although I'm a sucker for the whole cyberpunk futuristic look. Other than that it's nothing too special.Story: The voice acting is pretty bad, which makes it hard to care about the characters. The story itself is relatively straightforward and cliched, and is a whopping 3 hours long, so that is definitely not a selling point of this game. The writing is uninspired, although there was one line that made me laugh: "I've got two balls and neither one is crystal."Gameplay: The gimmick of this game is the use of large amounts of water to your advantage, whether it be to access high areas, put out fires, or sweep enemies off of their feet. That feature itself was pretty well done, but it was not utilized very often, and when it was, it was laid out step by step. There was absolutely no intuition required, which made the mechanic pretty boring. Other than that, the cover system is frustratingly bad, the gunplay is unsatisfying, and the controls are stiff.Overall, don't spend your time or money with this game, unless you're a...uh...water fanatic? It's really nothing special and I found myself frustrated more often than entertained. 3/10

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
It's not very good. 4/10.It's Unfinished: It feels like a demo you have to pay for. The game time I have is the entire game, minus the challenge room (about ~30 extra minutes).Terrible Voiceacting: Grating, low-quality, and the script was probably written by a 16 year old with a Tumblr blog.Impressive Physics: It feels like the entire budget went into the water physics, since it's the best thing about this game! It's a very unique trait in a video game.Awful Campaign: The story explains literally nothing, and ends as if you beat a demo for a full game. If anything, this was just to test the physics engine they used for the water.No Content: It's just a collectathon with only a handful of mediocre achievements and nothing to explore. It's a very minimal and boring game.Additional Notes and CommentaryI can't repeat it enough, but this literally is just a demo to me. The campaign is incredibly short, and ends abruptly like you just finished the first chapter of a really long campaign; except you kill the only main antagonist in the story.The only reason it got any score is because the physics engine used for the water was impressive and fun to mess around with. You could flood hallways and entire rooms by shooting weak walls or shattering windows, or even just opening doors! Then you could shoot explosive barrels to make all sorts of crazy physics happen. This was literally the only good thing in the game to me.Would I recommend this game at all? Absolutely not. I bought it for about $2 and think it shouldn't be worth anything at all. The story was terrible, the voiceacting was probably the worst thing about the game, and it made me skip every cutscene in the game, because it was nothing but a guy over a comm making sex jokes at the female protagonist.

												6/10 Marginal thumbs up. Got this for $1.24, so I wasn't expecting much. I played through in 5 hours but you could easily do it in 3, so not much content. Completing the game opens up a challenge room, but I had no desire to continue. The premise had a lot of potential, but the story is corny. ("Neo-Malthusians"? Really?) Voice acting is fairly lousy, especially the main character, Kate Wilson. Not much variety in combat or level design. Lara Croft-style climbing and ledge jumping were a plus. But the water physics are amazing and save the game from the scrap pile. The puzzles involving water keep the game interesting enough. You get a really cool superpower late in the game, but too late to be very satisfying.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												I bought this game to test my new debit card for 0,49 euros back before refunds existed...I regret spending that money.This...is a very, very bad game. I wanted to beat the game for the sake of being able to give a review based on the complete game, but I just couldn't make myself finish it. In the hour and a half spent on the game, I finished around half the game judging by the collectibles and chapter select. It just isn't worth any more time.I am desperately trying to find something positive in this game. If I had to pick, I would say that for the time when this game came out, the water physics are pretty good. Other than that...First of all, apart from water, everything else looks bland and generic. Not only are the graphics bad, with human animations being some of the worst I've seen, but apart from fire and water, everything else is either grey, blue, yellow or red. During the time I spent with it, I never left generic sci-fi corridors which all look the same.There is a story, but the dialog and voice acting are so awful that I couldn't make myself listen to them. And even if I did, it is impossible to piece together what is going on. Somebody is attacking the station our protagonist lives on, for reasons I never understood, nor could get myself to care about. The characters are so bad and generic, there is some hint that the protagonist is special in some way but I didn't reach that point in the game, and I think that even if I did I wouldn't care.The pacing and gameplay are also very bad. In the time I played, I only had two enemy encounters, the rest was platforming and swimming. Not very challenging, and very boring with little to no challenge. There were a few puzzles, but those seem more like padding than actual gameplay mechanics. And the controls are terrible, often causing me to jump in a completely different direction from the one I wanted.All in all, don't buy this game, it isn't worth your time, nor your money.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2015
												So my initial impressions of this game were that is was a fairly low budget production with some interesting ideas and good use of in game physics, particularly with regards to the water. Well worth a purchase in a sale for a 3-4 hour experience. However, that's when I got to Act 2 and the crashes began. The performance of this game divebombs after Act 1 on my system, with near constant framerate drops and frequent enough crashing to become intrusive, particularly prominent in an experience as short this. To add to this frustration, voice acting and subtitles began to desync and stutter the further into to game I progressed, the games conclusion is painfully lacking and the "Challenge Room" unlocked as post game content is quite frankly the worst and most shallow wave based horde mode I have ever experienced.I wanted to give this game a recommendation as at its best, it presents competent exploration and at the very least an average experience overall, but the simple facts of game instability and the bad taste left upon completion would make this dishonest.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Hydrophobia, a cross between adventure and third person shooter. The game starts on a giant ship which houses tonnes of people. You play as a mechanical engineer who is trying to foil the terorist attack on the vessel.The game is relatively cheap at $5 (I got it for about $1 at sale :D). The main selling point of the game is the water mechanics. You can control the flow of water to open paths and even defeat enemies. The water graphics are really good (it looks and moves fluidly). Now for the bad points. Although the water graphics are good, other models (ie. characters, environment) seem somewhat bland. The voice acting isn't that great either, nor is the story unfortunately. The biggest problem I had with the game were lag spikes. Alot of lag spikes. Although it's a single player only game, it lagged and even freezes (for a few minutes at a time) on me in several areas even after lowering all the graphical settings to bottom. I play games like retribution and crysis  fine with minimum lag, but this game struggles to run for some reason. The third person shooting is also clunky as the movement controls aren't great.Overall, the game does try to be unique with the water mechanics, but it doesn't make up the the under par graphics, story, controls and bugs. I haven't finished it (due to the bugs), but after spending 2 hours in it I'm not really compelled to play it. Save your money people.
