number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 6, 2014
												     Hydrophobia: Prophecy is an interesting concept that fails too deliver on serveral fronts. The story revolves around Kate Wilson a security agent on a massive ship named "Queen of the World". The homeworld (presumably Earth) lacks resources too sustain human populations; a lucky few live in luxury on the Queen of the World out in the ocean. The cruiser is attacked by a terrorist oragnization known as the Malthusians, a not so clever reference too economist Thomas Malthus. It is up to Kate and what is left of the security forces too navigate and salvage the sinking ship.     Where Hydrophobia fails is in exectution. The game is near impossible too play with a keyboard and is very difficult too use a controller as well. The puzzles are relatively easy, as the game itself always points you in the right direction. The voice acting is absolutely atrocious. The voice actors have no emotion in reading a poor script, which eventually grates on the players ears. Nobody talks like they do in Hydrophobia, in some circumstances it was humorous, but overall really detracted from the overall game. Terribly adapted Japanese animes have better lines then this game. The more I found myself playing the game the more I wanted too turn it off. The pretty water and occasional shootouts do not salvage this game. I can only recommend purchasing this game if it is on sale with a huge discount. Even then you are not missing out. -Alex

content:
Posted: July 24, 2012
												Great game. Water Physics pay for the game itself, I spent a lot of my time just seeing how big a wave I could make opening a door or trying to find places I can destory to flood the whole room.The main character isnt exaggerated. When terrorists bombard her work, she doesnt grow a beard, put a cigar in her mouth and go to town with machine guns and bombs spounting cheezy one liners like.."DROWN IN HELL!"Your friend Scoot is a cool dude and I enjoyed his antics.Hacking, although it was cake, I thought was nice new approach and it never seemed like a waste of time.The first gun is your best gun, it overshadows everything else. I dont think the point was to just shoot people though, they added so many things you can break and blowup to kill enemies with it really doesnt matter what gun you use.Lastly, I wouldnt buy into the hate, this game is as good as any other game out there and I found the expirence to be a steal compared to its price.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 11, 2011
												This game had quite a bit of potential going for it, all of which falls flat on its face by the end. The controls are clunky fit awkwardly with the sudden changes in camera behavior, especially when entering water. Enemies will appear seemingly at random around you, including behind you and from locations you were just in. Graphical glitches crop up frequently, including ones where the floor and wall textures fail to load. The design flaws are numerous, including one noteable example of being knocked to my death in a forced animation by a scripted sequence where terrain collapses as the character is climbing up some debris.The level design is poor, not utilizing any external environments at all which could have aided in both the game's quality and length  as it's set on a giant boat yet at no point do you go outside and are instead relgated to wandering a series of corridors within the ship's bowels. Also, this game is very short, only a few hours of play at best.Buy only under $5.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												Hydrophobia can be interesting or flat out boring, depending on whether you let flaws get in the way or not. Like most people, I have gotten this game in a bundle on Bundle Stars.Graphics: Decent. Though they appear "shiny" and can make it rather difficult to play, they aren't horrible and can be much worse. Like many other people have pointed out and a big part of the game, the water details are stunning even when set on the lowest texture setting.Gameplay: When it comes to rating a game I try to stay positive, but let's be real now. The controls are god awful. There are plenty of alternatives the developers could have used to make the controls simple and easy to learn. Instead, I have to smash my keyboard to get off from cornering the wall. The story line isn't too bad, but is overly cheesy.Sound Effects and voice acting: Sound effects are neat-o. The voice acting isn't too great but at least they were putting in an attempt. Believe me when I say I have heard MUCH worse.Overall Score: 3/5. It's better than what most people make it as, but isn't THAT great. It's entertaining to play if you have nothing else to do, but not worth the asking price. Wait for it to go on sale or get it in a bundle.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												The game despite being short and quite repetative is worth playing. Why? First let me tell you what is wrong with the game (there is quite a lot!)Cons:-Character handles poorly, especially in 3 deminsional environments.-Story lacking explaination and execution.-Character develpoment: Non Existant.-Missions very repetative.-Platforming not imaginative (in most cases).-Enemies are not very difficult to defeat.-Voice acting is quite bad.-Lip syncing is awful.-Repeated models (for example in one scene two identical men, are lined up and exacuted)...Now you are probably thinking, 'What is the point of playing this game then?'The most standout feature of this game is the level of exploration. At times the game reminds me of the film Posidon Adventure. The game is very good at making the player second guess themselves, and ask questions. Now while this level of exploration is not consistant, for the parts that it is in makes this game highly enjoyable.This game for me personally is a showcase (eventhough to my knowlege it is not), a showcase of the possibilities for games made by larger companies. For example if bioshock or bioshock 2 implmeted the water system that this game uses it could have been probably one of the best games of the decade (it still is very good).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												This is actually a pretty damn enjoyable game (especially at the DAFT-CHEAP price of 40pence(!) when on sale)The Movement / Cover and Weapon usage is passable to Good...Sadly, the story / acting both pretty poor.butMany of the other mechanics here are Decent and FULL of Potential (this was originally planned as a D/L trilogy but only part 1 was ever released)The climbing/Bal;ancing/swimming etc all work nicely together, but the Best Bits of all - and something that happens in No other game- is the water mechanic where the water has real weight and heft. You are on a gigantic sinking ship and, say, you're in a corridor, and a sealed room next to you is full of sea-water, you can shoot out the window and it'll come pounding into the corridor washing everything (and you / Bad Guys) away Very Realistically.You can Electrify the Water/Put out Fires, and so on, Escape as Ocean slowly fills a whole ships levels up with swirling,pushing Ocean, with you desperately trying to get out before it gets to the ceiling and you have no breath left etc. All this Dynamic is unique in gaming and solidly Exciting to enact.(the main character, 'Kate' I think, had a childhood accident in a small Dinghy that killed a Family member, so now she is terrified of Water/Drowning: (Hence the "HydroPhobia" of the title) and she begins to freak out when water gets over her head). The potential for this Tech is just boggling...(if they were ever return to Rapture say, for the final time - With the whole place coming apart,piece by piece, Then this Water Tech would be Incredible to use.Also it was only like a 7 Person team who made this, so not entirely fair to judge by AAA standards - Personally, I think it stands up fairly well, and could have gone on to do Great things ( as you get some kinda 'Water-Controlling' Tech, later in the Game - And use it to overcome the Bads /Solve puzzles Etc which is utterly unique idea ) . Damn Shame.Microsoft bought the Engine in 2010ish but haven't done a thing with it since then - Even a new "Silent Hunter" Sub-Sim, with huge rolling waves at Sea would be Super-Good, I hope they DO do Something with it (or Give it to the MODders to use)WELL WORTH THE PRICE - I personally enjoyed the Game; and was awestruck by the potential of the Tech seen here  7.5/10

												It is quite decent game. Will not knock your socks off but it has enough unique(ish) twists and gameplay to be worth it on this age of generic shooters. About 6 hours of campaign with little side exploration - as much as this is possible as game is relatively linear. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												So, this game is very short, and the combat is sub-par, but it is still a good game to grab for the price.It is a very cool game, the water physics is very fun to mess around in, and it is very good. The combat could use some improvement, but overall it is alright. The main problem is the climbing. If you do not run Vsync, you are going to have a very bad time. If you don't believe me, try to compare. You have to run it with it, it makes the combat so smoother, and you cannot complete the game without it, so make sure to enable it. The other lacking part is the story. Bland, boring, and most of all, it doesn't have an ending. It has no closure, and it kinda just rolls to the credits, which is a shame, because it seems like a cool world. You are on a giant ship, and it starts to flood from a terrorist attack. That is pretty much all they say. You don't know why, you don't know the characters, you only really learn your name from the character talking to herself (Which I still don't know what it is.) But still, if you like Tomb Raider, you will probably enjoy this game.6.75/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												Overall: 7/10Graphics: 8/10Gameplay: 7/10Story: 6/10I know this game gets a bad rap for being short and having a lacking story, but I found it easy to get into the story and keep up.  It's something you have to pay attention to.  I didn't find the story really all that boring, I'm just disappointed that you don't get your powers until late in the game when they're a bit irrelevant.  (I'm so used to shooting my guns that I don't know if I'll use the powers much.)  I also liked that the main focus, water, had life to it.  It wasn't just something that was everywhere and utterly useless, you could actually use it to progress in the game.  Need to go up one level but no stairs/ladder/etc?  Can't go through a door because there is a fire right in front of it?   Shoot a wall and ride the flood.   Need to get to the next part of the story and don't feel like killing your way through a group of 10 guys?  You guessed it, OPEN THE FLOOD GATES AND SHOOT DOWN SOME POWER LINES.  Too many indie developers go for generic, popular themes such as the ever popular Zombie shooter or some post-apocalyptic world that has little to no back story as to how things happened (or it takes forever to know the full story).  It's refreshing that they did their own spin on a futuristic dying Earth where the problem was over-population and not some catastrophic apocolyptic event.  For $5($0.49 during steam sales), this game gives you your money's worth and 8 times out of 10 you'll enjoy playing this for a few hours.  I got this through a Humble Bundle, so I didn't pay more than $0.10 for it, therefore take what I say with a grain of salt.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
												I honestly do not understand the reasons for such low scores on this game.For the time period, this was pretty neat graphically, and I am always happy to check out engine attempts.The water physics are really well done here, and even if the game feels a bit hollow at the core, it playes decent and I am having fun.Considering how cheap this gets on sale, WTH is wrong with people wanting to complain so much?What is this game like?  Kind of like a level based Resident Evil-ish stirred in with a bit of Budget Raideresque climbing and jumping.What do you get for your dollar or so on sale?  You get an average title that attempted to display some new ideas in an engine, a decent bit of playtime, and a story that isn't as bad as a good majority of games like it.Would I suggest a Buy?  He11 yeah I would!This is not the action game of the year, but it is a complete and working title that does exactly as I expected.If you want something that is not super pricey, and yet can still return on your dollar (literally less than a pouch of crisps).Buy it on sale if budget, or "engine concept" games interest you.Do not buy this if you want a $30+ polished supergame.

												this game doesnt know what its trying to beFirst its really poorly controlled platforming, then it throws puzzles like tomb raider except not as good or well thought out, then its thrust you in by the second act into a poorly done third person shooterThe story is laughably bad, The game is set in the mid 21st century when the world has fallen into the chaos of the "Great Population Flood", and takes place aboard the Queen of the World, a city-sized luxury ocean vessel, built by a group known as the Five Founding Fathers At the beginning of the game, the craft is bombed by a group of fanatical terrorists known as the Malthusians—named after political economist Thomas Malthus who predicted that population growth would one day outpace agricultural production, returning society to a subsistent level of existence.[6] The Malthusians have a plan to murder the vast majority of humans on the planet, so that the survivors wouldn't suffer from the effects of the population explosion.  written on the walls such as "kill yourself" which you find all over the ship you play Kate Wilson who is an engineer on the ship & whines about everything while getting her friend nick to help her get off the slowly sinking shipThe writing for this story is beyond terrible, its cringe worthyfor example Kate gets mad at nick for not warning her about 2 enemies in the next room, his response "kate i have 2 balls & none are crystal"  This line right here made me want to drop the controller Hydrophobia feels like a nice little tech demo to display this new Hydro engine, which the water is beautiful buttttt why should i care when your game built for the engine is so cocking awfulAvoid at all cost

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2014
												I regret buying this game. Sure I may have paid only 49 cents for it, but the game also took a valuable 30 minutes I could have spent sitting on a cactus. My laptop can run Bioshock Infinite at 60 fps on medium settings but bursts into flames when trying to handle this incredibly ugly game, barely reaching 20 fps when all the graphics are set to minimum and the resolution is Playstation 2 era 640x480.You play as... some woman whose name I can't remember, who's on a boat for.... some reason with some dribbling♥♥♥♥♥♥ when you're boat is suddenly attacked by... something... and you need to escape to... somewhere, and you do this by fighting the horrible camera controls, which fly up and down as if the game was being shot by a person on a malfunctioning crane lift - and suffering a seizure. You try to travel through water with unwieldy swimming controls, making it so that you constantly dive under water for no reason other than "screw you", and from time to time, a button prompt will appear telling you to press 'E' to climb a ladder to pick up an object, only for the game to not register your button press until you've backed up and tried pressing 'E' three more times.This isn't even the sort of game like Ride to Hell or pre-patch Total War: Rome II, which could best be described as "hilariously bad", where you could call up a few of your mates and laugh together at the baffling levels of ineptitude on display. It's just teeth-grindingly annoying, especially when the mandatory 3rd-person Uncharted-style climbing bits show up where you can't jump from one pipe to another, your vision in impaired by all the water splashing on the camera, and you can neither look nor climb down because trying to program that was much more work than simply waiting for the player to die and respawn at the far away check point.I don't even want to continue this review. I've used up far more time thinking about Hydrophobia than it deserves on top of the half hour I spent trying to work through the glitches, bugs, terrible graphics, and framerate the speed of a powerpoint presentation. My money was stolen; my time was wasted; my Steam library carries another scar; atrocious game gets to ♥♥♥♥ off.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												The water effects and quantity in this game are great, but pretty much nothing else even approaches average.Apparently, this was supposed to be episode 1 in a trilogy, but the rest will never get made, so the player character ends the story on a cliffhanger and the other main good guy character simply disappears late in the game and never reappears. The game literally ends with what feels like an incomplete cutscene.Voice acting is bad. Reminded me of the "Reboot" series from the 90s or something similar. Everyone kind of seemed like small-town community theatre actors.One of my "cardinal sins" of bad game design is introducing completely new game mechanics in the final 5-10% of the game, and this game does that.Gameplay is repetitive and sometimes unclear, and the only "challenges" come from frustrating design decisions like very unclear routes you have to take while your oxygen supply requires you to go directly to the exit with no detours, as well a couple areas with respawning enemies that you can't see under the water.Combat is average or below. There are thousands of explodable objects that you can use to kill enemies, which means very little challenge, really.The final boss fight is pretty stupid and easy.All in all, the game will take you about 2.5-3 hours to beat, although it really does feel tedious even at that length.Anyways, if you've got $0.50 and really really really want to see some nice water effects, you might want to buy it, but there are probably over 500 better games that cost less than $5 on Steam if you're willing to wait for sales, and life is pretty short...

content:
Posted: September 17, 2014
												The game despite being short and quite repetative is worth playing. Why? First let me tell you what is wrong with the game (there is quite a lot!)Cons:-Character handles poorly, especially in 3 deminsional environments.-Story lacking explaination and execution.-Character develpoment: Non Existant.-Missions very repetative.-Platforming not imaginative (in most cases).-Enemies are not very difficult to defeat.-Voice acting is quite bad.-Lip syncing is awful.-Repeated models (for example in one scene two identical men, are lined up and exacuted)...Now you are probably thinking, 'What is the point of playing this game then?'The most standout feature of this game is the level of exploration. At times the game reminds me of the film Posidon Adventure. The game is very good at making the player second guess themselves, and ask questions. Now while this level of exploration is not consistant, for the parts that it is in makes this game highly enjoyable.This game for me personally is a showcase (eventhough to my knowlege it is not), a showcase of the possibilities for games made by larger companies. For example if bioshock or bioshock 2 implmeted the water system that this game uses it could have been probably one of the best games of the decade (it still is very good).

Posted: April 2, 2015
												The voice acting is terrible and the jokes are really corny. Most of them are pretty facepalm worthy. The gameplay isn't half bad though. That seems to be its redeeming quality. It's a little frustrating at times, as in not always clear where you need to go or what you need to do, but that happens in some games. Not a big deal. I haven't been confused enough to check a walkthrough or anything. I bought it on sale a while back and honestly I'm glad I did. It has interesting ideas, but less than great execution. I just get the feeling that it could've been better. It's fun to play, though. If you aren't a fan of underwater combat and other things of that nature, I'd say avoid it. If you're going to buy it, I would suggest getting it on sale. The story is kinda "meh", but I've seen worse. It seems like one of those games that's more about gameplay than story. Still, if you think it looks interesting, I'd say give it a shot.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												Although my feelings for this game are mixed, I'm going to give it a recommendation. It's not necesarily a bad game (at least if you have a responsive keyboard and mouse--something I did not have a majority of the game), but the entire story feels rushed. The ending is just kind of there and I found myself questioning what even happened to every main character--except Mila. The voice acting and music is mediocre, but they do their jobs fine. The highlight of the game would have to be the visuals--especially the water. The game isn't very difficult (I played on hard mode and only took more than an hour and a half  because my keyboard was running low on batteries), but the difficulty could be both a good or bad aspect depending on the player. Overall, the game isn't great but considering it's $4.99 and goes on sale for $0.49, it's a solid buy. In short, I give Hydrophobia a solid 75/100 and a buy it if you have the extra change.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												Overall: 7/10Graphics: 8/10Gameplay: 7/10Story: 6/10I know this game gets a bad rap for being short and having a lacking story, but I found it easy to get into the story and keep up.  It's something you have to pay attention to.  I didn't find the story really all that boring, I'm just disappointed that you don't get your powers until late in the game when they're a bit irrelevant.  (I'm so used to shooting my guns that I don't know if I'll use the powers much.)  I also liked that the main focus, water, had life to it.  It wasn't just something that was everywhere and utterly useless, you could actually use it to progress in the game.  Need to go up one level but no stairs/ladder/etc?  Can't go through a door because there is a fire right in front of it?   Shoot a wall and ride the flood.   Need to get to the next part of the story and don't feel like killing your way through a group of 10 guys?  You guessed it, OPEN THE FLOOD GATES AND SHOOT DOWN SOME POWER LINES.  Too many indie developers go for generic, popular themes such as the ever popular Zombie shooter or some post-apocalyptic world that has little to no back story as to how things happened (or it takes forever to know the full story).  It's refreshing that they did their own spin on a futuristic dying Earth where the problem was over-population and not some catastrophic apocolyptic event.  For $5($0.49 during steam sales), this game gives you your money's worth and 8 times out of 10 you'll enjoy playing this for a few hours.  I got this through a Humble Bundle, so I didn't pay more than $0.10 for it, therefore take what I say with a grain of salt.

Posted: October 22, 2012
												Overall? Poor. Puzzles? Abysmal. Combat? Terrible. Water Combat? Even Worse. Story? Okay. Movement? Incredibly non-fluent. Voice acting? OH MY GOD PLEASE STOP. Water Physics? Fan-♥♥♥♥ing tastic. Hydrophobia Prophecy is an extremely poor game surrounding an amazing engine. I wish the water was put out by fire. I wish I could play with the water. I wish there was more combat involving environmental factors. I wish the AI wasn't completely stupid. I wish the water was involved in puzzles instead of poor gimicky combat. Basically, I wish Hydrophobia Prophecy was a good game. Look at the logo. It shows you using the lovely magic water power. You don't get that in a long long time. By then, the game frustrated me beyond redemption, and even then playing with the water was disappointing. I do not recommend it. And that's sad, because I can't tell if watching the great water physics was worth the 4.79 I paid.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												Not the greatest game ever, the entire game feels very clunky, difficult to tell where people are shooting at you from, where the heck you’re going, and walking around is difficult, and swimming can be downright impossible. These serve to make the game infuriating, as you bumble your way around a sinking ship; being shot at by everybody you meet. What’s worse is the game’s supposedly ‘unique’ water powers don’t show up until basically the end of the game, and they are SUPER lame. All you can do is pick up stuff and toss it around using giant pillars of water. And as soon as you get these powers the game is basically over after a very annoying boss battle.Honestly, the game sucks. It’s basically a half-baked piece of crap. The game has a very interesting premise, and with more work could have been a good game. Sadly the game falls very short of anything close to fun, and can only be described as an annoying experience that you keep waiting to get better, when you finally expect it to get good, the game ends. My recommendation is to not get this game, if for some god awful reason you want this game get it while on sale.

												This game is basicly an action adventure game with excellent, actually the best in any game so far, water physics. Playing around with the water is really fun. Enemies will attack you from land and fom inside the water (which is cool!) and they bleed out nicely.Shooting doesn't feel too great unfortunately. The controls could be better. A challenge room (which I didn't play) will add a few hrs if you like that kind of thing.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												Probably one of the only games to have such a majority of underwater combat. This was a really fun game, though pretty short. The water simulation was as real as they advertise, and controlling the water later in the game is a definitely good feeling. Sure it takes about half the game to get the water powers, but it reminds me of KotOR; you spend most of your time on Taris as a non-Jedi, but getting those Jedi powers makes it oh so worth it. Also, while dying numerous times, I experienced no glitches.Srsly. On sale for $0.50, you can't go wrong. I only wish they'd make a sequel...or give it Steam Workshop support.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
												Hydrophobia's got novel gameplay and setting, and some seriously impressive water (I spent a lot of time staring at it through the wireframe scanner... the tech is beautiful). Water (and fear of water) are used very well to implement some unique and fun gameplay. Cool hacking and a smooth introduction of new gameplay throughout the game keep it interesting, and the story is promising, as well.Unfortunately this game's clearly rushed near the end, with a large amount of story elements and gameplay mechanics presented to the player all at once. This was originally going to be an episodic release and never saw any sequels. The game still reaches an ending that's fairly satisfying, despite that.The survival mode you unlock by winning at least serves as a fun way to explore the cool new moves they introduce at the end.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 2, 2011
												Where do I start? First of all, I'm guilty of playing this game on a computer that barely meets the minimum requirements. I have to say, the graphics are phenomenal, the rendering is near perfect and the enviromental effects (water, fire, smoke) are absolutely stunning. It's truly a beautiful game, but after you get past oogling at it's undercarriage you realize a few things:  The controls are as spastic as a schizophrenic hummingbird, the storyline is painfully generic and the gameplay is complete crap. This is the "fixed" edition of the game that the devs gave a once over because of previous complaints and It still sucks. When you're a 110 pound girl in a cruise ship filling fast with water and shaking like a crack-♥♥♥♥♥ in rehab, fine tuned controls mean everything, and when you can't even get that right, you've got a game that's doomed from the start. This game is like buying a '67 Shelby Cobra in mint condition without a steering wheel and the break lines are cut. Disappointed...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 24, 2013
												Not at all a perfect game, Hydrophobia is a little mediocre as a shooter, and it's low budget shows from time to time. Individual segments feel hit or miss, but give it a try though and you will find some uniquely fun puzzles and water based combat. The water is the real star here, as Hydrophobia's developers seem to have made the game as a showcase for their fluid rendering engine. (Before going bankrupt shortly after) The water effects and physics are the best I have seen to date, and the sinking ship feels oppressive and urgent. Its a lot of fun just to play with the water in the ship's corridors.Taking it for what it is, I had more fun in Hydrophobia's campy, sometimes muddled world than I have had in most AAA titles.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												Hydrophobia can be interesting or flat out boring, depending on whether you let flaws get in the way or not. Like most people, I have gotten this game in a bundle on Bundle Stars.Graphics: Decent. Though they appear "shiny" and can make it rather difficult to play, they aren't horrible and can be much worse. Like many other people have pointed out and a big part of the game, the water details are stunning even when set on the lowest texture setting.Gameplay: When it comes to rating a game I try to stay positive, but let's be real now. The controls are god awful. There are plenty of alternatives the developers could have used to make the controls simple and easy to learn. Instead, I have to smash my keyboard to get off from cornering the wall. The story line isn't too bad, but is overly cheesy.Sound Effects and voice acting: Sound effects are neat-o. The voice acting isn't too great but at least they were putting in an attempt. Believe me when I say I have heard MUCH worse.Overall Score: 3/5. It's better than what most people make it as, but isn't THAT great. It's entertaining to play if you have nothing else to do, but not worth the asking price. Wait for it to go on sale or get it in a bundle.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												This game plays a lot like if Tomb Raider were made by an indie developer, except replace Lara Croft with the whiniest protagonist since my gigapet who I refused to feed in 4th grade. Seriously, the real hero in the story is Scoot for having to put up with it.That being said, it's a lot of fun. I'm not far along in the game, but it's got some epic moments only minutes into gameplay. Outrunning the waves of water that plow into the rooms and explode out the walls is extremely impressive and very cool.The story is very great as well for as much as I've played. Basically you're on a ship (I think?) that's being taken over by a terrorist group/cult and sunk into the ocean. You play as Kate, who I'm assuming was like a Cruise assistant lady or something...I don't know, and I don't care. This game has done me a huge favor in sparing me the dumb details and giving me a simple, kill the terrorist, escape the ship, and don't drown experience. Also everytime she says "Jesus," in a bad situation, it sounds like she is literally addressing the Son of God. You'll hear it everytime now too. Enjoy!

content:
Posted: October 10, 2013
												Unique. Certainly not the longest game I've ever played nor the most in depth story, but unique to be sure. A nice assortment of weapon ammo with various ways to dispatch enemies, whether that be through direct damage, explosion, fire, or drowning.  Nifty mapping system with a neat pda-style way of locating objectives.  There is constantly the sensation of feeling like you're about to drown, especially since about 50% of the game takes place underwater.  All in all a pretty good game.  I'm glad I played it, enjoyable enough to experience the water physics alone.  I give it a solid "B".  Not B-, not B+, just "B".

												When I wrote the evaluation I'm at the final boss and achived 54% of the steam succes for this game.Imagine a world when the water have subbmerge a lot to say not the entire earth and puts the humanity to live under it. And then, terrorist appear from nowhere. Ok, it may not make sense. But the woman you will play with is a badass for kicking terrorists.Actually, the scenario is not bad, and after the half of the game, your caracter will have a great power that make the gameplay a little bit more powerfull. The gun with the different type of amunation is a good thing too for the gameplay.I found some camera and IA bug, just little onces. Nothing very bad that make you quit. The gameplay is fine for me, you have a lot of possibilities. Cover behind boxes or walls. Swiming is a little bit hard to learn when you want to do up and downs in the water. You can catch object in the water ... That kind of stuf.The final boss is pretty hard, I saw a video to help but he is pretty hard. And the game is quick to finish, but the succes are a challenge you can not avoid ;) .I do not really find a lot of bad point for this game. If you are a fan of Oni, the Bungie game that was on PC and PS2 in 2001-2002, you will like the game.For me it's a 14/20.

content:

												Well, i really wanted to like this game, but it just does not deliver.. Controls are clunky, especially the kind of superpower that you will get literally 5mins before the finale. Too bad you'll need it to win that ridiculous boss battle. Story has so many dead ends (for example line with the secondary character just ends abruptly and you will never heard about him ever since, I know that devs maybe wanted to use that for sequel, but still) and also the ending feels very rushed and anti-climaxic. It is not entirely bad, but you just can't help to feel, that it could have been so much more.. Oh, and who hired the voice actress for the main protagonist? Also who thought that she should moan constantly when you are even ankles deep in the water which.. DUH!.. you will be pretty often.. Sry but i can't recommend it unles you REALLY love water physics, don't mind ankward controls, mediocre story with rushed end and last but not least bad voice acting.

												Shorthand: Game was decent but had room for more. Felt pretty short but kept things moving along. much of it was disorienting yet felt familiar enough from other games. Worth 5 bucks (price as of review posting)  The gameplay was pretty decent. the concept was surely there, but the end result felt very incomplete and somewhat unsatisfying.   The power ups were fun, the weapon diversity was good enough, but like the power ups, the better stuff came way too late in the game to enjoy. Especially while fighting the end boss. I got frustrated because it felt so suddenly almost impossible that if you didn't master the controls and special powers they JUST literally gave you in the last few levels, you are not going to win on your first try (that or i just totally suck at gaming) not to mention i didn't even realize I was fighting the end boss til I actually beat it (about a dozen tries) and was expecting the next level to load.--Grats if you read this far!SoRabo Studios thanks you for reading this review and if you bought this game after considering this review, YAY! if not. aww. ok, tired, rambling, punctuation mis-use, words.

Its sad, the lack of support for such a awkward aspect ratio. I mean graphically they used an awesome engine, its looks great runs great. Just mechanically, its total trash. Imma have to remove surround and play with it as 1080p. Also i believe the story is saved to your steam account, so no matter what comp you log into, you still have yor process saved, which is amazing ofr this old of a game. 2011, not decades old, but not new non the less.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												I bought this game despite the negative reviews because I remember playing a demo for it a while back on Xbox Live. I remember enjoying the short demo, but it was too expensive at the time. I played the first 1 and a half acts....and I don't even really want to continue.The graphics are low quality for today's standards, so it isn't all that attractive. The graphics kind of give me a headache. And I am, by no means, a graphics buff.In addition, the controls and the camera are just...disorienting. I found myself getting a little dizzy, even after turning down the mouse sensitivity.And then the gameplay is frustrating. There were several times when I had no idea what to do. And that's not because the game doesn't hold your hand. It tells you exactly where to go next. It's just graphically not clear how to get there. I spent 15 minutes walking around a room because there was a place I needed to get to that I knew I should be able to get to by climbing the piping, but she wouldn't grab the pipe for no reason at all. I finally found out I needed to shoot out a wall and that the pipe I was trying to grab was just...not intended to be grabbed...It was slightly bigger than the pipes you use throughout the game, but they expected you to just ignore this path in favor of shooting a wall.I still think I'm going to finish the game, because I hate leaving games unfinished. I already spent an hour and  a half on the game, I may as well spend the second hour and a half to get the payoff. Because I know the gameplay and graphics aren't the strong points of this game. It must be the story, right?I'm dreading re-opening the game....I wouldn't wish this on anyone. Don't bother with this game.
